Prompt

Under what conditions is person A (at t) identical to person B (at t’)?

Pick one of the following answers to this question and defend it in depth:

  1. Psychological Continuity
  2. Material/Bodily Continuity
  3. Dualist Theory

A good answer must a) properly explain the puzzle of personal identity, b) explain the chosen answer carefully, c) identify one key objection to the view, and d) defend the theory against that objection.

Further Instruction

This assignment covers material from the textbook in ‘Part II: What is our Place in the World?’ The following four short papers are relevant:

  • 36: ‘Personal Identity: a Materialist Account’, Shoemaker
  • 37: ‘An Argument for Animalism’, Olson
  • 38: ‘Divided Minds and the Nature of Persons’, Parfit
  • 39: ‘Personal Identity: the Dualist Theory’, Swinburne

You should read each of these four papers carefully. Do not use outside resources. It will save you time to focus on just these four. You will be completing this assignment in several stages. Find the grade breakdown and timeline below:
